span.strong: VISALIA UNIFIED SCHOOLS ARE CURRENTLY CLOSED
Please click on the icons below for information on the temporary school closure.

img.alt: Update on Meals and Distance Learning (April 17, 2020)

a.span: Update on Meals and Distance Learning (April 17, 2020)

div.p: On Tuesday, April 14, 2020, the District distributed curriculum packets at our grab-n-go meal sites and bus stops and in the evening at our District Office. The learning packets are also available online along with other learning resources. The curriculum packets cover three weeks of school–from now to May 1, 2020. Click on the headline for more...

a.title: Go to comments for Update on Meals and Distance Learning (April 17, 2020)

img.alt: Update on High School Curriculum, Testing, & Commencement Ceremonies (April 16, 2020)

a.span: Update on High School Curriculum, Testing, & Commencement Ceremonies (April 16, 2020)

div.p: Curriculum for VUSD high school students is available on the Visalia Unified website (www.vusd.org) and is organized by individual courses. This will allow students and parents can access courses that are specific to their students’ unique schedule. The digital curriculum was designed by teachers at each high school for students to continue their learning for this semester. Click on the headline to read more.

a.title: Go to comments for Update on High School Curriculum, Testing, & Commencement Ceremonies (April 16, 2020)

div.p: We understand how important it is to attend to the social and emotional needs that arise during this time of uncertainty related to the coronavirus (COVID-19) and school closures. If you need social emotional support or encouragement or just someone to talk through worries and concerns you have, our school psychologists and school social workers are here to talk with you. Click on the headline to read more.

a.title: Go to comments for VUSD CareLine

img.alt: Social Emotional Wellness During School Closure

a.span: Social Emotional Wellness During School Closure

div.p: Social & Emotional Learning (SEL) offers a powerful means to explore and express our emotions, build relationships, and support each other – children and adults alike – during this challenging time. Visit the VUSD Social Emotional Wellness Resources During COVID19 website to find resources and tools to help support the social emotional wellness of students, parents, and educators.

a.title: Go to comments for Social Emotional Wellness During School Closure
